dialogue.introduction: 12th Kagerou-class destroyer, Isokaze. Commander, let's proceed together. You do not need to worry.ã€€
dialogue.library_intro: 12th Kagerou-class destroyer, Isokaze. If it's about combat experience, I won't fall behind that Yukikaze. I've fought again and again, participated in decisive battles, and fought to the bitter end. Yamato, Musashi, Kongou, Taihou... their last moments have been etched into my eyes. This time... I will protect them.
dialogue.secretary2: Commander.. I don't dislike your persistence but, what exactly are you doing?
dialogue.secretary3: So be it... Isokaze shall be your opponent. I won't show mercy even if the commander should stand before me.
dialogue.secretaryidle: Commander...The 17th Destroyer Division, can sortie at any time... Hamakaze and I are ready... right Hamakaze?
dialogue.secretarymarried: Admiral, have you been eating well? If you don't eat and an emergency occurs, you may not survive it. Even surviving is a splendid battle in itself. So, let's go to Mamiya to eat.
dialogue.wedding: Commander, what? This important discussion. Is it about the 17th Destroyer Division's formation? What, it's not? Then is it something about that Hamakaze? It has nothing to do with Hamakaze... I see. Nn... That ring... to me... w-what... eh! U-um...
dialogue.equipment1: You're right... upgrades are necessary, thanks.
dialogue.equipment2: I appreciate it... with this, I can keep fighting.
dialogue.supply: Re-supplies are important. Battles cannot be fought without them.
dialogue.docking_minor_damage: I'm going to go get rid of some of this battlefield dust.
dialogue.docking_moderate_damage: I'll stay behind in order to fight another day. It's fine, I'll be back right away. Don't worry.
dialogue.docking_complete: Looks like repair has been completed... hmm...
dialogue.ship_construction: A new ship has been completed. We've bolstered our forces.
dialogue.battle_start: Enemy fleet sighted. All ships, prepare to attack.
dialogue.attack: Fire, fire, fill them up with holes.
dialogue.night_battle: We'll finish off the rest of the enemies. Follow my lead.
dialogue.night_attack: You shouldn't underestimate how strong I am now.
dialogue.artillery_spotting: You shouldn't underestimate how strong I am now.
dialogue.night_special_attack_modifier_cutin_at_n: You shouldn't underestimate how strong I am now.
dialogue.support_expedition_team_arrival: You shouldn't underestimate how strong I am now.
dialogue.mvp: Nn... Isokaze's contribution has been recognized yet again. No.. such paltry deeds are not worth celebrating over.
dialogue.minor_damaged1: Tch... There's so much more left in me, don't underestimate me.
dialogue.minor_damaged2: kugh... but I can still sail.
dialogue.moderately_damaged: Darn it. I cannot be stranded in this place. Move, move it!
dialogue.sunk: I can no longer move... but I will not cause trouble for everyone else. I'm sorry Yukikaze... Would you do me one last favor?
dialogue.fall_2015: Commander, I'm sorry. Forget this happened.

hourly.0000: The date has changed. I, Isokaze, will be reporting the time for today. What? Are you dissatisfied with it?
hourly.0200: 0200. It's night. What? Is there any dissatisfaction?
hourly.0300: 0300. Gah... Commander, you're making such a difficult expression. Do you have something you want to say?
hourly.0400: 0400. It is almost morning. I think I understand what is it that the Commander's so dissatisfied about, but...
hourly.0500: 0500. But, even if I, Isokaze, is entrusted with matters outside combat. I will give it my best shot.
hourly.0600: 0600. It is morning. Well then, it's time to make breakfast. What's with that look?
hourly.0700: 0700. It's all right, Hamakaze told me how to do it. Here, it's done. How is it?
hourly.0800: 0800. Commander, what's wrong? You have a stomachache? That's no good, it'll hinder your commanding abilities.
hourly.0900: 0900. Commander, did your stomachache go away? Aren't you lacking daily training?
hourly.1000: 1000. Good, it is time for practice. The 17th Destroyer Division is ready to set sail anytime.
hourly.1100: 1100. Leave the lunch to me as well. Tanikaze taught... Ah, why are you running away. Commander!
hourly.1200: 1200. It's noon. Here are combat rations from Tanikaze. To have rice balls on the sea is something exceptional.
hourly.1300: 1300. The rice balls were delicious, right? Even though Tanikaze might not like look like it, she's really adept at taking care of others.
hourly.1400: 1400. Good, it is time for a real sortie. Let's dispatch our main fleet.
hourly.1500: 1500. Afternoon snacks? No, no, I don't want it. I'll grow an excess bulge if I do.
hourly.1600: 1600. Commander, let's strike the tough enemy fleet. Of course, we'll pick the line ahead formation. What, diamond formation you say? You don't understand. You don't understand!
hourly.1700: 1700. Commander, the day is going to end soon. How time flies. Even in a single day.
hourly.1800: 1800. Commander, the dinn-- Why are you running away? It's all right, Urakaze will be helping me.
hourly.1900: 1900. I-it took quite sometime but dinner is ready. Commander, how is it?
hourly.2000: 2000. That savory egg custard, too, is from Urakaze. Ah, that grilled fish is from me, Isokaze. Is it good?
hourly.2100: 2100. Thank goodness for Urakaze... Cooking is hard.
hourly.2200: 2200. So it's time. Good, it's time for night battle practice. 17th Destroyer Squadron, everyone gather all around!
hourly.2300: 2300. Commander, thank you for your work today. I look forward to another fine day tomorrow.
